result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Arraignment on June 21, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

8:52 AM Defendant DALE A POSTHUMA in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael J Kapelis in court for DALE A POSTHUMA.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. State has one witness.

Daniel Restrepo sworn, direct by ADA McElroy is a Trooper for the Wisconsin State Patrol. Was employed on the date in question. Testimony given. Venue established. Identified the defendant present in court. ADA requests the Court take judicial notice of Columbia County cases. Atty Kapelis objects. Court will take note. Cross exam by Atty Kapelis. Redirect by ADA McElroy. Redirect by Atty Kapelis. Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony has been committed and that the felony probably was committed by the defendant and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files an information with the court. Attorney Kapelis requests  an Arraignment be scheduled. Court sets for Arraignment on June 21, 2022 at 1:15 PM. 

Motion to modify Bond - Statement by Atty Kapelis. Argument by Atty ADA McElroy. Court denies the request to modify bond. 

Court adjourned at 9:02 AM
Defendant's
Preliminary hearing on May 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

9:37 AM Defendant DALE A POSTHUMA in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael J Kapelis in court for DALE A POSTHUMA.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Kapelis confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading and requests a preliminary hearing. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. Court notes bond has been set.  Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing. Defendant does not waive the time limits. 

Court adjourned at 9:39 AM.

Court will set for Preliminary Hearing on May 17, 2022 at 8:30 AM. Schedule for 1/2 hour.
(Atty Michael Kapelis)
